website_summaries.verdict: The HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus inkjet all-in-one offers the convenience of Web connectivity, but both business and home users will prefer the Epson WorkForce 840's reduced footprint and versatility.
pros: The HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus has an ample feature set that includes AirPrint and ePrint functionality as well as print, scan, copy, and fax functions, automatic duplexing, and an autodocument feeder
cons: The printer is big, slow to power on and pricier than competing models, and a single 250-sheet input tray reduces its appeal for busy offices

customer_reviews.title: Severe buyer's remorse
customer_reviews.text: Had this printer now for about 11 months. I've had more problems with it than I have ever had with any printer. The wireless doesn't work half the time -- need to reset the printer to get it to connect. And now I can't get anything to print properly even though the ink cartridges are full and I've ran the clean printhead multiple times, even after inserting new cartridges. Decided to buy a new printer for just a few dollars more than what it would cost to buy a new printhead for this printer. Won't buy HP again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne E. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Terrible brand
customer_reviews.text: Dont waste money on HP. They trick you with ways to waste your ink. Tests, forcing colors to merge to make black wasting your color. Coded ink cartridges to expire on date even if they are still full. Garbage never again
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: Ratings of used products need to be accurate.
customer_reviews.text: The product, an HP Printer, arrived in a damaged and torn, lightweight cardboard box. Printers come in heavy weight boxes for a reason. The flatbed cover/had a broken off hinge, one of the three. The power wires to the feeder/cover were not connected. The top had several long shallow scrapes. It was sold/described as Used - Very Good. It cannot have been checked out before classifying it as saleable and selling it. At least the return process seems straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nightmarish color reproduction. You won't find worse. Shame on you, HP!
customer_reviews.text: The printer is easy to set up and use, but the color quality is just awful. AWFUL. Prints on photo paper are dark and somewhat clouded. Color prints on paper are unbelievably bad, even with very high quality paper. Seriously, I thought that some of my ink cartridges were empty, and replaced them. Even with fresh ink the pictures have banding, and the colors couldn't be farther off. Blond hair turns hellish red, black hair becomes white. It's nightmarish. Even the worst quality newspaper print run looks 100 times better than this. HP should be ashamed for selling this terrible, terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Worst Piece of JUNK Printer I have ever owned...
customer_reviews.text: Printer was purchased for our business and never worked properly from day one..I have owned a lot of HP Printers over the years and figured this one would be a great upgrade from our older HP..What a mistake. Half the time it doesent print the other half you have to push the page for it to catch the paper. We had two techs look at it and they told me to throw it in the lake!!! What a P.O.S...If you like lots of stress and aggrevation buy this printer..I tried to return it and they said they will fix it..been down that road before.What do we do in the meantime close out shipping business? What a waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Big Consumer

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap. I swear this is the last HP Printer ...
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap. I swear this is the last HP Printer I will ever buy. The software package I think is the main culprit You have to turn it off and on every time you want to use it and it takes forever to boot. Seems to use a lot of ink too. Way to slow and expensive. Support sucks too.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: When it faxes and scans it misses
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this is a beautiful printer and would meet all my needs completely. I love the interface and it is easy to work. But it simply does what is unforgivable in a scanner or printer and makes my work twice as hard-- it misses pages!! I don't mean skip by taking two at a time because it will take them one at a time in the automatic feeder but then when i scan or fax 8 pages for example page 3, 5 7 missing in the final product, or pages 2 and 4 or pages 4 and 6. ALWAYS!!! Well 90 percent of the time anyway. Frustrating. i gotta get rid of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Louie Clarence

customer_reviews.title: This turned to one of the worst electronics I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The printer was on a surge protector that protected both the power and fax line the entire time it was used. After a year it said every cartridge that was put in it was a refilled/counterfeit. Soon after that it Automatic feeder quit working. The printer lasted about 3 years and then malfunctioned leaked a entire magenta cartridge on the top of a very expensive mahogany desk ruining the top of the desk and then the printer would no longer turn on. Hp has really gone down hill taking in the fact that we got rid of a B/W Hp printer that was 13-14 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin5040

customer_reviews.title: A great printer for home office
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this printer. It's on my network and I can print or scan from any computer on the network. It's much faster and quieter than the LaserJet 4500 it replaced, and takes up a lot less space in the home office. The duplex unit for making double-sided prints is a big plus for saving paper when printing out drafts or notes. I print out lots of items duplex and 2 pages per side so I end up with 4 "pages" on each piece of paper, a big savings on paper and size of the printout that I have to carry with me.
customer_reviews.author: dst

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: The 8500A Plus is an excellent application for a home printer. It has all the bells and whistles along with superb support that I received from the HP Techs. The only difficulty I encountered was trying to get the fax setup so that I could continue to have my voicemail phone service. There are several adjustments that must be made but once completed, the unit functioned very well. I also like the fact that one can save significantly on the ink as the standard black cartridge is good for about 1,000 pages and the XL cartridge does 2,200 pages.
customer_reviews.author: ILEVE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly so far. Had to hire someone to install, no directions with item.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie A Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Paper Jam Problem
customer_reviews.text: I really like the printer. The quality of prints and the speed are great. BUT, when I suffered my first paper jam I realized that this printer does not open up like in the clam style of my previous HP Printers. I've owned many HP Printers over the years and didn't know that was an item to look out for. It is extremely difficult to get inside the printer to remove the jammed paper. Very frustrating and I'm ready to trade it in.
customer_reviews.author: seattlegirl

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: This is the second HP printer that I've owned. I liked the first one so much that I bought another of the same type as a replacement. This one is more sophisticated. I've had some set up problems which several HP phone technicians have patiently helped resolve.They even sent me a replacement printer because of some problem with the first printer. Overall, I'm pretty satisfied, but it took some time, effort a patience to get here.
customer_reviews.author: FredSchl

customer_reviews.title: After a few years of use, I got that ...
customer_reviews.text: After a few years of use, I got that dreaded ink supply failure. Did every kind of trouble shooting, including new ink cartridges; it won't work! Every time need to do hard reset by unplugging power card and then it will for a short period of time! and then back to square one! Customer does not have to go thru this.
customer_reviews.author: user 888

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer. I love the ease of use and the efficient ink use. Do not use refilled ink jet cartridges as it won't see that it has full cartridges and my printer stopped printing and even ruined the print heads. Wireless printing works great along with scanning, faxing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Never Again !!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had several HP printers in the past .... no problems. This 8500A under light use is a big disappointment. I would go on but can find NO redeeming qualities. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy from them!
customer_reviews.text: This printer did not work when we received it! Was not supposed to have ink in it but was all over the inside of the package. What a mess! And it does not work!!
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great Low Cost for Ink
customer_reviews.text: We had little trouble with setup and it did most of it automatically. We bought this printer primarily for it's low cost for ink; the additional features are also good; i.e., auto duplexing and touch screen. We expect to get 4-5 reems of print out of the set of ink cartridges for less than 4 cents a page. The print quailty is great on the draft level.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Black

customer_reviews.title: scanner software is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The scanner software they are now using is terrible. I scanned the exact same document on a older 8500 and on this new one. The old model with the solution software scanned the pages in with a file size of 1.2 MB. The new model which does not offer the solution center software scanned in with a file size of 13.7 mb. with the exact same settings PDF. 300dpi, color. I scanned out of Bluebeam and the file size was 2 MB. HP has a good printer but their software is very lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: HP OFFICEJET PRO 8500a Plus
customer_reviews.text: Amazon shipping and handling was outstanding as always. Arrived on time and in great condition. I am very pleased with my new HP Officejet Pro 8500a Plus. I replaced my older HP Officejet Pro 7500. Easy to install and set up. Printing quality is excellent. Bluetooth accessibilty is great. As a Realtor, I appreciate the ability to scan and email or print 25 copies at a time ... we have many-page contracts ... I no longer have to run into the office to scan multiple copies. Overall, I am very pleased and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Internetwurks

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its weakness has been reliable pick-up on glossy or thicker paper.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the home. We would recommend this product to anyone that is looking for an all in one printer. The HP staff was outstanding in addressing the Eprint issue we had. In our opinion this is the best all in one printer on the market and the price was right on Amazon.com. Based on all the research we performed before buying this was the best product and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Prostaff_mmw

customer_reviews.title: Forget this Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had three of these in a row...Each one lasts just past the warranty period and dies! There is an issue with the wireless configuration. It works well when plugged directly in but not with wireless connections! I am done....Grade F
customer_reviews.author: Planet--D

customer_reviews.title: No stars
customer_reviews.text: Doc tray gave up life before printer one year old brought in September 2016 died May 2017 per HP no warranty at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer - intructions could be better
customer_reviews.text: I was worried initially after reading many bad reviews concerning the printer not working properly after installation. I do think the directions were not clear, since they relied entirely on photos and no verbiage. This led to a problem of my not installing the printer heads correctly, therefore the printer kept telling me there was a blockage I needed to remove. After getting the printing heads to finally pop in correctly, the heads could now clear under the top frame of the printer and everything went smoothly from there. The unit is now working perfectly and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: This one can do it all well.
customer_reviews.text: We have been quite pleased with this copier, particularly because of its wireless feature that can accommodate the laptops in various parts of the house. The only complaint I have is that on rare occasion the paper feed wrinkles the paper as it either turns it over (for back to back printing) or sends it out after printing. We do not know why that occurs. We have not yet tried faxing, so I can't speak to how well it accomplishes that task. Certainly you are getting a tremendous value at the price paid for this all-in-1.
customer_reviews.author: Lifelong Romantic

customer_reviews.title: HP 8500
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful compact low profile design that has all of the features needed for a home office printer. Very easy to set up and connect to network.Quick response and great quality printing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Elmore

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't gotten a new printer in quite a while, boy have they changed. I highly recommend this printer. Great quality print, easy setup basically just plugged it in and it did the rest. I haven't had it that long so we will see how long it lasts. I imagine it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in LV

customer_reviews.title: Broken printer
customer_reviews.text: What aperies as a nice unit turns out to have a document feed problem. It doesn't feed at all. The printing is good but I need it feed , scan then print and of course no feed. I had hoped to hear from the seller but nothing as of yet. Phillip Hammerschmitt
customer_reviews.author: P.R. Hammerschmitt

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: It was defective upon receipt. I returned it, and was given a full refund for its price and the cost of returning it. So, end of the day, I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: David G. King

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus
customer_reviews.text: We have had numerous problem with this printer. My husband uses it for his home office and it is directly hooked up to the computer and it still will not print at times. He has been on the phone with tech support for an hour so fat and will be again because it is acting up. I recommend this product ONLY if you have the time to be on the phone with tech support. I wish I would have bought it from a local store because I would have returned it. So frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: HP printers not reliable
customer_reviews.text: It was like the last 2 HP printers I have owned. 2 years and they are shot with only light use. Printing became very poor and diagnostics said nothing was wrong although I suspected the printheads which are replaceable separately at a cost of $130. For the same money I bought a brand new highly rated Epson all-in-one. I am done with HP.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Lee Elder

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best all-in-one printer I have had. I have had no issues to date. It is great to not have to go into the office to get things done. I can do it right from my home office without having to settle for a reduction in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Blankman

customer_reviews.title: Returned as it was defective
customer_reviews.text: Returned it as it was defective and received my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Mac
customer_reviews.text: Have had this printer at home for the last few days. Seems to be working great! No predictions on how long it will last, but the parts seem sturdy enough. Setup was a breeze. HP does make you install a large set of drivers / software, but the utility works nicely with Snow Leopard.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys

customer_reviews.title: reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've used this printer for over a year, and it hasn't failed me so far. Of course the ink is expensive, but it doesn't consume much when printed in "draft" mode.
customer_reviews.author: C. Koontz

customer_reviews.title: Good all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: This printer is better than previous models - more durable. Works well but dont like the clutter and confusion of software. Way too much. Needs to be streamlined.
customer_reviews.author: James Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Office/Home Printer
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This is set up as a wireless network printer. I have a tower, notebook, netbook, & nettop computers feeding it and have had no issues. Set was very simple and straight forward. The printed copies are very good and scanning and coping is very simple. I have not utilized the fax function at this time. That will be coming soon.
customer_reviews.author: BS Sully

customer_reviews.title: okay so far
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen is not responsive enough, requiring a few touches to get it to work. The printer did not work for printing out Quicken checks and reports. I still have to mees with the printer selection to get it to print. I've wasted a lot of checks. All else seems okay. Getting it to print two sided is cumbersome, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: jewel

customer_reviews.title: Best Personal Printer I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic printer, although the document feed is known for jamming everything else is fantastic and works perfectly. A++
customer_reviews.author: R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: This is the second or third HP printer/fax I've had ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fine, reliable product. Easy to send commands from the computer, good color quality, easy to change and insert color paks. Operates from glass flat bed or automatic top feed.
customer_reviews.author: Portfolios

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus Wireless e-all-in-one Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer does an amazing job on photographs. And, it does all the other jobs I need done, efficiently. Overall, I am very happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thiel

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus
customer_reviews.text: This printer is better and more capable than what I expected. I was looking for a printer that had a reliable paper feed and nice clear printing. The copy and scan functions offer a lot of flexibility and are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: winemkr

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from Officejet 6200
customer_reviews.text: Arrived packaged well. Set-up instructions easy to follow. No problem linking with my wireless router. Love the feature that allows you to e-mail a document to your printer and it's waiting for you when you get home! The printer actually has it's own e-mail address. Machine is a little noisy, but not a major issue for me. Overall, very happy with purchase price and item.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a great printer that was just what we needed. However, it had three issues. The paper would not feed/pickup, the print heads were no good (accourding to HP), and it would not work wirelessly (even after 6 hours on the phone with HP). I probably just got a lemon and the printer is usually fine. I will say that Amazon's return system is awsome. It was very easy and fast to resolve the return.
customer_reviews.author: samson

customer_reviews.title: Love the printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer was easy to set up and is very easy to use! I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an all in one printer.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: New printer
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an older HP all-in-one. Do not have much experience with it yet but the images and text output are very crisp and vivid. The ink cartridges are outrageously expensive.
customer_reviews.author: peridoc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect printer
customer_reviews.text: Meet all expectations. Easy set up and use. Fast printing and software to manage the printer installed without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: DNAks17

customer_reviews.title: Received the dreaded "Alignment failed" error
customer_reviews.text: I initially loved this all-in-one printer/scanner/copier, but it ultimately burned through ink like it was going out of style and it ultimately succumbed to the "alignment failed" error that is prevalently found when searching the Internet for this printer. This error is the result of a failed print head which costs nearly as much as the printer. On a positive note, I called HP and complained about what is clearly a manufacturer defect and they backed up their product by offering me the latest iteration of this product at a deep discount.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as expected.  Bad actually
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer with high expectations after reading reviews. So far I've only used Laser printers. I am very disappointed by this HP printer. It constantly interrupts the printing, asking for paper reload when there is still a stack in there. It is also very slow and noisy. I will buy another Brother Laser printer instead.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Franz MD

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: the paper feed SUCKED!!! it keeps on jamming the machine. I have to replace it because i cannot have a machine that jams often and a patient is waiting for their report. The straw that broke the camel's back was a small piece of the paper tear inside the machine when the copy was coming out, and i cannot clear the jam and yet the machine wont let me do anything else until the jam is cleared. WHAT JAM?? save ur money and headache and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: missing u

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: having compatible issues with Windows 8, not able to use all functions or menus especially scanning
customer_reviews.author: GO

customer_reviews.title: Purchase of HP8500A Plus Printer
customer_reviews.text: This machine has loads of technology for the price. I am still wary of the cost of supplies having read the prior reviews, but, have not had to order anything yet. This is a secondary printer for my business as I do limited color printing and needed a backup fax/scanner.
customer_reviews.author: britcritic

customer_reviews.title: Meets our needs
customer_reviews.text: This is the second 8500 we bought. It prints my wifes cards well. Has been trouble free to this point
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Olson

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product for the price. It has wonderful features, with easy to follow intuitive instructions. It's quick and quiet, and the print quality is standard.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: hp officejet printer
customer_reviews.text: like this printer especially for the price, we replaced our 5 year old printer and liked the fact that ink is considerably cheaper per print page (of course if their info is correct!) works well and like the touch screen easy to use
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working well after purchasing new printhead. The cyan red printheads that came with unit would never clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Bill & Gail

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: never worked upon arrival!!!!!!!!!! settled for a lesser model from supplier
customer_reviews.author: B Patrick Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Meets most of my requirements
customer_reviews.text: Came out of the box fine. Set up was reasonably easy all though a little confusing on the wife's apple. Can't get the wireless scan to computer to work on her computer. Wireless scanning was working on my computer then stopped working. Wireless printing works fine.
customer_reviews.author: smooth as silk

customer_reviews.title: HP OfficeJet Pro 8500A Plus
customer_reviews.text: Printer was easy to setup and the quality of the prints are excellent. Touch screen display works great and makes setup simple. Printer is a great addition to any small business or home office and the printer looks great as well.
customer_reviews.author: nvargas

customer_reviews.title: very bad printer with very bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: just used for one and half months and it can no longer receive the fax. called HP and they can also not fix it and give the excuse for the telephone line. That is really bad company. Do not buy it before you regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: I am super pleased with the printer
customer_reviews.text: super easy to set up and it was fast. If it only make coffee it would be the perfect printer for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Santana

customer_reviews.title: The best Printer ever
customer_reviews.text: I will use in my home office. Installation very simple. Just connect it, and put the CD on your computer. That is! Inclusive ask for be the default printer. ePrint is amazing. Scan is perfect. The only funtion I will not use is the fax.
customer_reviews.author: FDRS

customer_reviews.title: great home or small office printer
customer_reviews.text: The set up was extremely easy and the printer is perfect for our home and small office needs. Would definately recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: jacksonville, florida

customer_reviews.title: Include ink cartridge with your order
customer_reviews.text: Purchased printer one week ago. After 92 b/w copies the yellow ink cartridge needs to be replaced. Plan on purchasing extra ink with your printer. Will not print b/w if yellow or any other color needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: SmallBizIA

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My primary worry before I bought this printer was what I had read from previous reviewers about set-up. I had absolutely no problem. Printer has worked great since then. The touch screen adds little value to me but does work fine.
customer_reviews.author: dilbarsf

customer_reviews.title: Runs good.  East install. No problems.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, downloaded the software from HP and started using it. Works well. Satisfied with the purchase. Price was right.
customer_reviews.author: STAHLY

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Seller didn't describe the problems that this printer has in his description.
customer_reviews.author: Blum Sr

customer_reviews.title: HP Officjet Pro 8500A Did not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions were explicit and easy to follow. The setup and installation process went smoothly. So far, it has performed flawlessly. On the all important bang for the buck issue, this HP unit earns 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Treat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use one of these at work and didn't hesitate getting one of these for home.This is an excellent product.Delivery was on time.A good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Seminole1967

customer_reviews.title: hp 8500
customer_reviews.text: All aspects of this printer worked the first time it was used. I called customer service to help with the setup and they were very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: enancy

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Wonderful printer! It is kind of loud when printing. The touch screen is not very "touch" sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Deen78

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding printer. The scan option of sending a .jpg or .pdf to your email account after scanning is really nice. Setup with a mac does not require the CD if you are using Snow Leopard or Lion, the OS will grab the drivers for you. It comes with a phone 2-prong/copper phone cord so the fax will work with a VOIP fax line. Couldn't be any happier.
customer_reviews.author: J. Holland

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: yes, I think that is just the rate, it's good the product and recommend it to everyone. thanks to all
customer_reviews.author: amilcar joaquim

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet 8500A Plus
customer_reviews.text: Over all nice all in one product. Arrived in good condition. Somewhat complicated to set up, especially the wireless printing. The instructions do not exactly match what needs to be done to set it up for wireless. Plan to spend an hour for set up with all that needs to be done.
customer_reviews.author: HansBloom

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing. It just works. Had it for about two months now and no problems and still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Viper

customer_reviews.title: USB cord
customer_reviews.text: Product is very good but please include a USB cord with the product. Most people need one and it is a real pain to start setup and then need to run to buy an overpriced USB cord.
customer_reviews.author: Badger54

customer_reviews.title: Printer crashes often
customer_reviews.text: Every other document or just out of the blue, printer crashes and demands a reboot. Sometimes it works after reboot and sometimes it just crashes again. Other than that it would be a neat device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus
customer_reviews.text: Last year we purchased 2 of these for our team. The ease of use of all the functions from scanning directly to your computer to copying single & double-sided docs, is amazing! The quality of the print is perfect too. We now own 6 of these with 1 more on the way. This is perfect for a small or large office who is trying to save on duplication/scanning costs. I would recommend to any home businesses too.
customer_reviews.author: Kim, Auburn Hills, MI

customer_reviews.title: Easy to  install and use.
customer_reviews.text: When I received my printer I was a little hesitant at hooking it up by myself. Finally, a week later, I was brave enough to try it and was I ever surprised. It was so easy, and works beautifully....I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: jeanne

customer_reviews.title: UNHAPPYATTORNEY
customer_reviews.text: WHAT YUTZ CREATED A MACHINE FOR OFFICE USE WHERE YOU HAVE TO TAKE OUT THE PAPER TO INSERT/PRINT ENVELOPES? SERIOUSLY. PEOPLE WHO DO NOT DEFINE THEMSELVES AS TECHNO-REFUSE-TO-BATHERS USE THESE MACHINES. THIS IS BEYOND RIDICULOUS.
customer_reviews.author: compulsivereader

customer_reviews.title: HP Printer 8500A
customer_reviews.text: I have not installed the product yet. Will wait to review later. It will be a month before I install it. Printer has been installed for several months now. It is performing better than expected. Photo pinting is great, scanning feature works well, seldom jamming or skipping pagees. We are very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: kk

product_meta.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus Wireless e-All-in-One (CM756A#B1H)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Print professional-quality color for up to 50% lower cost per page and energy use than lasers with the HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus e-All-in-One, which delivers impressive maximum prints speeds of 35 pages per minute black and 34 ppm color. This inkjet printer meets your connectivity needs with both wireless and Ethernet networking, and it also lets you connect to your PC with Hi-speed USB 2.0 or print without a PC using memory card slots. Store your business documents on the Web and quickly access and print them directly from this inkjet printer using print apps and the 4.3" color touchscreen. You can also quickly fax files or scan to a PC or e-mail and use HP ePrint to send photos, documents and more from any mobile device directly to the HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus e-All-in-One.This all-in-one has legal-size flatbed scanner, a 250-page paper tray and a 50-page automatic document feeder. It handles a range of paper types and cuts down on paper usage with automatic two-sided printing. The HP Officejet Pro 8500A Plus e-All-in-One also saves you money with high-capacity, individual ink cartridges.



WHY BUY?
 * Create professional-quality color for up to 50% lower cost per page and energy use than lasers1
   
   
 * Stay productive with the 50-sheet automatic document feeder
   
   
 * Send print jobs from any mobile device with e-mail capability using HP ePrint2
   
   
 * Use AirPrint™ to print from iPad®, iPhone® or iPod touch®3

Enlarge
FUNCTIONS



WEB CONNECTED
Access and print from the Web using the color display and apps



HP ePRINT
If you can e-mail it, you can print it using HP ePrint2



AIRPRINT™
Simply print wirelessly from your iPad®, iPhone®, and iPod touch®.3




FEATURES
EnlargeBuilt-in Wireless Printing
Print from any room without using cables


Built-in Wired Networking
Share your printer with multiple people


Two-sided Printing
Save paper by printing on both sides automatically


Memory Card Slots
Print photos without using a PC


Color LCD Screen
Edit photos and/or manage your printer easily


4 x 6 Color Photo Printing
Print brilliant photos for albums or to enhance business documents


Auto Document Feeder
Fax, scan and copy multiple pages automatically


INCLUDED NOT INCLUDED

SPECIFICATIONS
Print Speed Up to 35 pages per minute black, up to 34 ppm color4; 4" x 6" photo as fast as 76 seconds


Scan Resolution up to 4800-dpi optical


CopyCopy both sides of an ID onto a single page


Paper Handling 3" x 5" to 8.5" x 14"; up to 15,000 pages per month


Enlarge
REMEMBER ORIGINAL HP INK AND PAPER SAVE MONEY when you choose high-capacity cartridges over standard ones
RECOMMENDED HP INK5

9401,000 pages940XL2,200 pages


940900 pages940XL1,400 pages


940900 pages940XL1,400 pages


940900 pages940XL1,400 pagesRECOMMENDED HP PAPER

HP Advanced Photo Paper


HP Premium Plus Photo Paper


HP Bright White Inkjet Paper






MORE INFORMATION

Datasheet (PDF)

Product Overview

WHICH HP PRINTER IS RIGHT FOR YOU? 
Compare the good, better and best, side by side 

See Comparison Chart



 1. Majority of color laser AiOs <$600, March 2010; for details, see http://www.hp.com/go/officejet. OJ Pro ISO yield with highest-capacity cartridges based on continuous printing; see http://www.hp.com/go/learnaboutsupplies. Energy use based on HP testing using the ENERGY STAR® program's TEC test method criteria.
 2. Requires an internet connection to the printer. Feature works with any internet- and email-capable device. Print times may vary. For a list of supported documents and image types, see www.hp.com/go/ePrintCenter.
 3. Supports iOS 4.2 devices (iPad, iPhone 4, iPhone 3GS, and 3rd and 4th generation iPod touch) that support multitasking. Works with HP ePrint-enabled printers and All-in-Ones. AirPrint and iOS 4.2 devices require an 802.11 wireless network connection to the printer. Wireless performance is dependent upon physical environment and distance from the access point. AirPrint and the AirPrint logo are trademarks of Apple Inc. iPad, iPhone and iPod touch are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
 4. After first page; see www.hp.com/go/inkjetprinter for details.
 5. Average based on ISO/IEC 24711 or HP testing methodology and continuous printing. Actual yield varies considerably based on content of printed pages and other factors. Some ink from included cartridge is used to start up the printer. For details see www.hp.com/go/learnaboutsupplies.
